title: David Drinkell, organist with an international reputation who helped restore the instrument to the musical mainstream – obituary
text:
David Drinkell, who has died aged 63, was one of a select but notable band of English organists who rose to international prominence.

He was keen to restore the instrument to the mainstream of contemporary music making and the remarkable breadth of his industry brought not only greater recognition for the organ itself, but also proved pivotal in inspiring many younger performers.

Emerging in the 1980s as one of the finest organists of his generation, he maintained a busy career as a top-flight concert artist. Musically adventurous, precise and flawless, his virtuoso playing rarely failed to make an impression.
